snippet: Russia’s national obsession with fascism is playing down the darker aspects of Soviet history and obliterating objective debate over current foreign policy issues, critics say.
abstract: Russia's annual celebration of its victory over Nazi Germany has fueled debate; some critics claim that Russia's obsession with fascism downplays darker aspects of Soviet history and obscures focus on its current foreign policy issues; debate is heightened following Pres Vladimir Putin's signing of law that criminalizes actions that try to rehabilitate Nazism or denigrate Russia's World War II record.

byline.contributor: Nicolay Khalip and Alexandra Odynova contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Russia’s national obsession with fascism is playing down the darker aspects of Soviet history and obliterating objective debate over current foreign policy issues, critics say.

headline.main: Russia Revisits Its History to Nail Down Its Future
headline.print_headline: Russia Revisits Its History to Nail Down Its Future
